creator: bart_vanhaute_@hotmail.com
text:
An ant build file I have, is trying to update a jar file to include a modified
MANIFEST.MF. The build file works perfectly under unix, but under windows, I get
"Unable to rename old file to temporary file". 

Looking at the source code it appears that a rename fails (line 388), maybe
because the getParentFile() does not pick up the correct dir.

creator: peter.reilly@corvil.com
text:
Can you check if the jar file is currently in use
(maybe as part of a classpath)
On windows one is not allowed to overwrite a file
that another process has opened (in a lot of situations)
On unix one is allowed (in most situations).

creator: bart_vanhaute_@hotmail.com
text:
Thanks for the prompt response. It was indeed a case of file locking. And the
lock was held by ant itself (a custom ant task had the jar file still open). 

The error message did get me a bit puzzled: at first, it is difficult to relate
the message to the task of updating a jar. Maybe include the name of the file
that could not be moved.

Ok added the name of the file to the error message
Thanks.
creator: peter.reilly@corvil.com
